instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7050: What is D7050? Diodes between SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL and ground, these data lines allow the battery to communicate with the battery charging chip and the SMC..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
Hi guys.

I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> not recognizing batteries. Tried with original and 2 others new same thing.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 16.2v On charger only and same with plugged battery and also i replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <DIODE>D7050</DIODE>.

SMC issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>, it is shorted.
Be sure <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not recognizing battery
threads.message: Replaced it still the same. On <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> G2 i have 12v on G1 only 2v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not recognizing battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not recognizing battery
threads.message: In OS stays on same percentage and it says replace now/battery is not charging

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
You can only have 16V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> if <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> is shorted on high-side; or <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> internally, less probably.
Did you change <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not recognizing battery
threads.message: yes i changed <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> still the same and i tried another <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>. I need to find another <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> cause i don't trust this one from a board for parts...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
You don't need to trust a MOSFET; test it out of board.
Use Google, it should bring out some test methods for you...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Not recognizing battery
threads.message:
Yes i tested they were all good. Funny thing is that i've put a 2014 year model battery and works fine charging and holding. Don't know if the batteries are bad, but even with the original shows the same.

Thank you for your help
